<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Introduced in game</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.70</value></part><part><name>Version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>MPARGUMENTS</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>MPEFFECTS</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> A getter for [[allowDamage]] command. The command indicates if damage is allowed at current [[local]]ity, hence local effect of the command. A complete solution for being able to tell whether or not an object can be damaged at current locality looks like this:
<code>_canBeDamaged <template><title>=</title></template> [[local]] _obj && [[isDamageAllowed]] _obj;</code></value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[isDamageAllowed]] object </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[private]] _isInvincible = [[not]] [[isDamageAllowed]] [[player]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[allowDamage]], [[setDamage]], [[setHit]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value> This command only works locally. It always returns false when called on non local objects </value></part><part><name>MPBEHAVIOUR</name>=<value> 
</value></part></template>
